segment.source: First-run program (Surface Hub)
segment.target: First-run program (Surface Hub)

segment.source: The term \ 0034;first run \ 0034; refers to the series of steps you'll go through the first time you power up your Microsoft Surface Hub, and means the same thing as \ 0034;out-of-box experience \ 0034; (OOBE).
segment.target: The term \ 0034;first run \ 0034; refers to the series of steps you'll go through the first time you power up your Microsoft Surface Hub, and means the same thing as \ 0034;out-of-box experience \ 0034; (OOBE).

segment.source: This section will walk you through the process.
segment.target: This section will walk you through the process.

segment.source: First-run program (Surface Hub)
segment.target: First-run program (Surface Hub)

segment.source: The term "first run" refers to the series of steps you'll go through the first time you power up your Microsoft Surface Hub, and means the same thing as "out-of-box experience" (OOBE).
segment.target: The term "first run" refers to the series of steps you'll go through the first time you power up your Microsoft Surface Hub, and means the same thing as "out-of-box experience" (OOBE).

segment.source: This section will walk you through the process.
segment.target: This section will walk you through the process.

segment.source: By now, you should have gone through all of the previous steps:
segment.target: By now, you should have gone through all of the previous steps:

segment.source: Prepare your environment for Surface Hub
segment.target: Prepare your environment for Surface Hub

segment.source: Physically install your Surface Hub device, and
segment.target: Physically install your Surface Hub device, and

segment.source: Setup worksheet
segment.target: Setup worksheet

segment.source: Assuming that's the case, first run should be both simple and quick.
segment.target: Assuming that's the case, first run should be both simple and quick.

segment.source: The normal procedure goes through six steps:
segment.target: The normal procedure goes through six steps:

segment.source: Hi there page
segment.target: Hi there page

segment.source: Set up for you page
segment.target: Set up for you page

segment.source: Device account page
segment.target: Device account page

segment.source: Name this device page
segment.target: Name this device page

segment.source: Set up admins for this device page
segment.target: Set up admins for this device page

segment.source: Update the Surface Hub
segment.target: Update the Surface Hub

segment.source: Each of these sections also contains information about paths you might take when something is different.
segment.target: Each of these sections also contains information about paths you might take when something is different.

segment.source: For example, most Surface Hubs will use a wired network connection, but some of them will be set up with wireless instead.
segment.target: For example, most Surface Hubs will use a wired network connection, but some of them will be set up with wireless instead.

segment.source: Details are described where appropriate.
segment.target: Details are described where appropriate.

segment.source: Note You should have the separate keyboard that came with your Surface Hub set up and ready before beginning.
segment.target: Note You should have the separate keyboard that came with your Surface Hub set up and ready before beginning.

segment.source: See the Surface Hub Setup Guide for details.
segment.target: See the Surface Hub Setup Guide for details.

segment.source: Hi there page
segment.target: Hi there page

segment.source: This is the first screen you'll see when you power up the Surface Hub for the first time.
segment.target: This is the first screen you'll see when you power up the Surface Hub for the first time.

segment.source: It's where you input localization information for your device.
segment.target: It's where you input localization information for your device.

segment.source: Note This is also where you begin the optional process of deploying a provisioning package.
segment.target: Note This is also where you begin the optional process of deploying a provisioning package.

segment.source: See Create provisioning packages if that's what you're doing.
segment.target: See Create provisioning packages if that's what you're doing.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: If the default values shown are correct, then you can click Next to go on.
segment.target: If the default values shown are correct, then you can click Next to go on.

segment.source: Otherwise, you'll need to enter data in the appropriate boxes.
segment.target: Otherwise, you'll need to enter data in the appropriate boxes.

segment.source: Country/region: Select the country or region where the Surface Hub will be used.
segment.target: Country/region: Select the country or region where the Surface Hub will be used.

segment.source: App language: Apps and features will display in this language and language format.
segment.target: App language: Apps and features will display in this language and language format.

segment.source: Keyboard layout: Select the keyboard layout for the on-screen and physical keyboards that will be used with your device.
segment.target: Keyboard layout: Select the keyboard layout for the on-screen and physical keyboards that will be used with your device.

segment.source: Time zone: Select the time zone where the Surface Hub will be used.
segment.target: Time zone: Select the time zone where the Surface Hub will be used.

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: Note Once the settings on this page are entered, you can't come back to this screen unless you reset the device (see Device reset).
segment.target: Note Once the settings on this page are entered, you can't come back to this screen unless you reset the device (see Device reset).

segment.source: Make sure that the settings are properly configured before proceeding.
segment.target: Make sure that the settings are properly configured before proceeding.

segment.source: When the settings are accepted, the device will check for a wired network connection.
segment.target: When the settings are accepted, the device will check for a wired network connection.

segment.source: If the connection is fine, it will display the Set up for you page.
segment.target: If the connection is fine, it will display the Set up for you page.

segment.source: If there is a problem with the wired connection, the device will display the Network setup page.
segment.target: If there is a problem with the wired connection, the device will display the Network setup page.

segment.source: If no wired connection can be found, then the device will attempt to set up a wireless connection, and will display the Network setup page.
segment.target: If no wired connection can be found, then the device will attempt to set up a wireless connection, and will display the Network setup page.

segment.source: Network setup page
segment.target: Network setup page

segment.source: If your device does not detect a wired connection that it can use to connect to a network or the Internet, you will see this page.
segment.target: If your device does not detect a wired connection that it can use to connect to a network or the Internet, you will see this page.

segment.source: Here you can either connect to a wireless network, or skip making the network connection.
segment.target: Here you can either connect to a wireless network, or skip making the network connection.

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: This screen is shown only if the device fails to detect a wired network.
segment.target: This screen is shown only if the device fails to detect a wired network.

segment.source: If you see this screen, you have three choices:
segment.target: If you see this screen, you have three choices:

segment.source: You can select one of the wireless networks shown.
segment.target: You can select one of the wireless networks shown.

segment.source: If the network is secured, you'll be taken to a login page.
segment.target: If the network is secured, you'll be taken to a login page.

segment.source: See Wireless network setup for details.
segment.target: See Wireless network setup for details.

segment.source: Click Skip this step to skip connecting to a network.
segment.target: Click Skip this step to skip connecting to a network.

segment.source: You'll be taken to the Set up for you page.
segment.target: You'll be taken to the Set up for you page.

segment.source: Note If you skip this, the device will not have a network connection, and nothing that requires a network connection will work on your Surface Hub, including system updates and email and calendar synchronization.
segment.target: Note If you skip this, the device will not have a network connection, and nothing that requires a network connection will work on your Surface Hub, including system updates and email and calendar synchronization.

segment.source: You can connect to a wireless network later using Settings (see Wireless network managment).
segment.target: You can connect to a wireless network later using Settings (see Wireless network managment).

segment.source: You can plug in a network cable while this screen is visible.
segment.target: You can plug in a network cable while this screen is visible.

segment.source: The device will detect it, and will add Next to the screen.
segment.target: The device will detect it, and will add Next to the screen.

segment.source: Click Next to continue with making the wired connection.
segment.target: Click Next to continue with making the wired connection.

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: If the device has a wired connection when it starts, and can establish a network or Internet connection, then this page will not be displayed.
segment.target: If the device has a wired connection when it starts, and can establish a network or Internet connection, then this page will not be displayed.

segment.source: If you want to connect the device to a wireless connection, make sure no Ethernet cable is plugged in at first run, which will bring you to this screen.
segment.target: If you want to connect the device to a wireless connection, make sure no Ethernet cable is plugged in at first run, which will bring you to this screen.

segment.source: No matter what you choose to set up now, you can use Settings to set up different connections later.
segment.target: No matter what you choose to set up now, you can use Settings to set up different connections later.

segment.source: If you want to connect to a secured wireless network from this page, click on the network of your choice, and then provide the necessary information (password or account credentials) to connect.
segment.target: If you want to connect to a secured wireless network from this page, click on the network of your choice, and then provide the necessary information (password or account credentials) to connect.

segment.source: See Wireless network setup.
segment.target: See Wireless network setup.

segment.source: Wireless network setup
segment.target: Wireless network setup

segment.source: This page will be shown when you've selected a secured wireless network.
segment.target: This page will be shown when you've selected a secured wireless network.

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: User name: Enter the user name for the selected wireless network.
segment.target: User name: Enter the user name for the selected wireless network.

segment.source: Password: This is the password for the network.
segment.target: Password: This is the password for the network.

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: The device will attempt to connect to the specified network.
segment.target: The device will attempt to connect to the specified network.

segment.source: If it's successful, you'll be taken to the Set up for you page.
segment.target: If it's successful, you'll be taken to the Set up for you page.

segment.source: Network proxy setup
segment.target: Network proxy setup

segment.source: This page will be shown when the device detects a wired connection with limited connectivity.
segment.target: This page will be shown when the device detects a wired connection with limited connectivity.

segment.source: You have three options:
segment.target: You have three options:

segment.source: You can select a wireless network to use instead of the limited wired connection.
segment.target: You can select a wireless network to use instead of the limited wired connection.

segment.source: You can skip connecting to a network by selecting Skip this step.
segment.target: You can skip connecting to a network by selecting Skip this step.

segment.source: You'll be taken to the Set up for you page.
segment.target: You'll be taken to the Set up for you page.

segment.source: Note If you skip this, the device will not have a network connection, and nothing that requires a network connection will work on your Surface Hub, including things like email and calendar synchronization.
segment.target: Note If you skip this, the device will not have a network connection, and nothing that requires a network connection will work on your Surface Hub, including things like email and calendar synchronization.

segment.source: You can connect to a wireless network later using Settings (see Wireless network managment).
segment.target: You can connect to a wireless network later using Settings (see Wireless network managment).

segment.source: You can select Enter proxy settings which will allow you to specify how to use the network proxy.
segment.target: You can select Enter proxy settings which will allow you to specify how to use the network proxy.

segment.source: You'll be taken to the next screen.
segment.target: You'll be taken to the next screen.

segment.source: This is the screen you'll see if you clicked Enter proxy settings on the previous screen.
segment.target: This is the screen you'll see if you clicked Enter proxy settings on the previous screen.

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: In order to make a network connection, you'll need to fill in either a script name, or the proxy server and port info.
segment.target: In order to make a network connection, you'll need to fill in either a script name, or the proxy server and port info.

segment.source: Proxy script: Provide the address of a proxy script.
segment.target: Proxy script: Provide the address of a proxy script.

segment.source: Proxy server and port: You can provide the proxy server address and port.
segment.target: Proxy server and port: You can provide the proxy server address and port.

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: When you click Next, the device will attempt to connect to the proxy server.
segment.target: When you click Next, the device will attempt to connect to the proxy server.

segment.source: If successful, you'll be taken to the Set up for you page.
segment.target: If successful, you'll be taken to the Set up for you page.

segment.source: You can skip connecting to a network by selecting Skip this step.
segment.target: You can skip connecting to a network by selecting Skip this step.

segment.source: You'll be taken to the Set up for you page.
segment.target: You'll be taken to the Set up for you page.

segment.source: Note If you skip this, the device will not have a network connection, and nothing that requires a network connection will work on your Surface Hub, including things like email and calendar synchronization.
segment.target: Note If you skip this, the device will not have a network connection, and nothing that requires a network connection will work on your Surface Hub, including things like email and calendar synchronization.

segment.source: You can connect to a wireless network later using Settings (see Wireless network managment).
segment.target: You can connect to a wireless network later using Settings (see Wireless network managment).

segment.source: Set up for you page
segment.target: Set up for you page

segment.source: This screen is purely informational, and shows which recommended settings have been enabled by default.
segment.target: This screen is purely informational, and shows which recommended settings have been enabled by default.

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: You should read this screen and note which services have been enabled by default.
segment.target: You should read this screen and note which services have been enabled by default.

segment.source: All of them can be changed using the Settings app if need be, but you should be careful about the effects of doing so.
segment.target: All of them can be changed using the Settings app if need be, but you should be careful about the effects of doing so.

segment.source: For example, Cortana depends on some of these settings, and may not work if you disable them.
segment.target: For example, Cortana depends on some of these settings, and may not work if you disable them.

segment.source: See Intro to Surface Hub for details.
segment.target: See Intro to Surface Hub for details.

segment.source: Once you're done reviewing the settings, click Next to go on.
segment.target: Once you're done reviewing the settings, click Next to go on.

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: The settings shown on the page have already been made, and can't be changed until after first run is completed.
segment.target: The settings shown on the page have already been made, and can't be changed until after first run is completed.

segment.source: Device account page
segment.target: Device account page

segment.source: On this page, the Surface Hub will ask for credentials for the device account that you previously configured.
segment.target: On this page, the Surface Hub will ask for credentials for the device account that you previously configured.

segment.source: (See Create and test a device account.) The Surface Hub will attempt to discover various properties of the account, and may ask for more information on another page if it does not succeed.
segment.target: (See Create and test a device account.) The Surface Hub will attempt to discover various properties of the account, and may ask for more information on another page if it does not succeed.

segment.source: Note This section does not cover specific errors that can happen during first run.
segment.target: Note This section does not cover specific errors that can happen during first run.

segment.source: See Troubleshoot Surface Hub for more information on errors.
segment.target: See Troubleshoot Surface Hub for more information on errors.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Use either a user principal name (UPN) or a domainuser name as the account identifier in the first entry field.
segment.target: Use either a user principal name (UPN) or a domainuser name as the account identifier in the first entry field.

segment.source: User principal name: This is the UPN of the device account for this Surface Hub.
segment.target: User principal name: This is the UPN of the device account for this Surface Hub.

segment.source: If you’re using Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) or a hybrid deployment, then you must enter the UPN of the device account.
segment.target: If you’re using Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) or a hybrid deployment, then you must enter the UPN of the device account.

segment.source: Domainuser name: This is the identity of the device account for this Surface Hub, in domainuser name format.
segment.target: Domainuser name: This is the identity of the device account for this Surface Hub, in domainuser name format.

segment.source: If you’re using an Active Directory (AD) deployment, then you must enter the account in this format.
segment.target: If you’re using an Active Directory (AD) deployment, then you must enter the account in this format.

segment.source: Password: Enter the device account password.
segment.target: Password: Enter the device account password.

segment.source: Click Skip setting up a device account to skip setting up a device account.
segment.target: Click Skip setting up a device account to skip setting up a device account.

segment.source: However, if you don't set up a device account, the device will not be fully integrated into your infrastructure.
segment.target: However, if you don't set up a device account, the device will not be fully integrated into your infrastructure.

segment.source: For example, people won't be able to:
segment.target: For example, people won't be able to:

segment.source: See a meeting calendar on the Welcome screen
segment.target: See a meeting calendar on the Welcome screen

segment.source: Start a meeting from the Welcome screen
segment.target: Start a meeting from the Welcome screen

segment.source: Start a meeting using Cortana
segment.target: Start a meeting using Cortana

segment.source: Email whiteboards from OneNote
segment.target: Email whiteboards from OneNote

segment.source: Use Skype for Business for meetings.
segment.target: Use Skype for Business for meetings.

segment.source: If you skip setting it up now, you can add a device account later by using the Settings app.
segment.target: If you skip setting it up now, you can add a device account later by using the Settings app.

segment.source: If you click Skip setting up a device account, the device will display a dialog box showing what will happen if the device doesn't have a device account.
segment.target: If you click Skip setting up a device account, the device will display a dialog box showing what will happen if the device doesn't have a device account.

segment.source: If you choose Yes, skip this, you will be sent to the Name this device page.
segment.target: If you choose Yes, skip this, you will be sent to the Name this device page.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: The device will use the UPN or DOMAINUser name and password for the device account to do the following:
segment.target: The device will use the UPN or DOMAINUser name and password for the device account to do the following:

segment.source: Check if the account exists in Active Directory (AD) or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD):
segment.target: Check if the account exists in Active Directory (AD) or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD):

segment.source: If a UPN was entered: the device will look for the account in Azure AD.
segment.target: If a UPN was entered: the device will look for the account in Azure AD.

segment.source: If a DOMAINUser name was entered: the device will look for the account in AD.
segment.target: If a DOMAINUser name was entered: the device will look for the account in AD.

segment.source: Look up the Microsoft Exchange server for the account’s mailbox.
segment.target: Look up the Microsoft Exchange server for the account’s mailbox.

segment.source: Look up the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) address for the account.
segment.target: Look up the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) address for the account.

segment.source: Pull the account’s display name and alias attributes.
segment.target: Pull the account’s display name and alias attributes.

segment.source: Exchange server page
segment.target: Exchange server page

segment.source: This page will only be shown if there's a problem.
segment.target: This page will only be shown if there's a problem.

segment.source: Typically, it means that the device account that you provided was found in Active Directory (AD) or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), but the Exchange server for the account was not discovered.
segment.target: Typically, it means that the device account that you provided was found in Active Directory (AD) or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), but the Exchange server for the account was not discovered.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Enter the name of the Exchange server where the device account's mailbox is hosted.
segment.target: Enter the name of the Exchange server where the device account's mailbox is hosted.

segment.source: Click Skip setting up Exchange services to skip this step.
segment.target: Click Skip setting up Exchange services to skip this step.

segment.source: If you do, people will not be able to:
segment.target: If you do, people will not be able to:

segment.source: See a meeting calendar on the welcome screen.
segment.target: See a meeting calendar on the welcome screen.

segment.source: Start a meeting from the welcome screen.
segment.target: Start a meeting from the welcome screen.

segment.source: Start a meeting using Cortana.
segment.target: Start a meeting using Cortana.

segment.source: Email whiteboards from OneNote.
segment.target: Email whiteboards from OneNote.

segment.source: See Intro to Surface Hub for details on setup dependencies.
segment.target: See Intro to Surface Hub for details on setup dependencies.

segment.source: You can enable Exchange services for a device account later by using the Settings app.
segment.target: You can enable Exchange services for a device account later by using the Settings app.

segment.source: If you click Skip setting up Exchange services, the device will display a dialog showing what will happen.
segment.target: If you click Skip setting up Exchange services, the device will display a dialog showing what will happen.

segment.source: If you choose Yes, skip this, then Exchange services will not be set up.
segment.target: If you choose Yes, skip this, then Exchange services will not be set up.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: The Surface Hub will attempt to validate the device account on the Exchange server that you enter here.
segment.target: The Surface Hub will attempt to validate the device account on the Exchange server that you enter here.

segment.source: If the Exchange server can be reached and validates, then first run will proceed.
segment.target: If the Exchange server can be reached and validates, then first run will proceed.

segment.source: If you choose to skip setting up Exchange services, the Surface Hub will stop looking for the Exchange server, and no Exchange services (mail and calendar) will be enabled.
segment.target: If you choose to skip setting up Exchange services, the Surface Hub will stop looking for the Exchange server, and no Exchange services (mail and calendar) will be enabled.

segment.source: Exchange policies page
segment.target: Exchange policies page

segment.source: This page will be shown when:
segment.target: This page will be shown when:

segment.source: The device account is using an Exchange Active Sync (EAS) policy where the PasswordEnabled policy is set to 1.
segment.target: The device account is using an Exchange Active Sync (EAS) policy where the PasswordEnabled policy is set to 1.

segment.source: There’s no connection to Exchange.
segment.target: There’s no connection to Exchange.

segment.source: Exchange returns a status code indicating an error.
segment.target: Exchange returns a status code indicating an error.

segment.source: (For example: The account has been provisioned to too many devices.)
segment.target: (For example: The account has been provisioned to too many devices.)

segment.source: Exchange supported protocols are not supported by the Surface Hub.
segment.target: Exchange supported protocols are not supported by the Surface Hub.

segment.source: Exchange returns incorrect XML.
segment.target: Exchange returns incorrect XML.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: This page is purely informational, so no input is required.
segment.target: This page is purely informational, so no input is required.

segment.source: However, you have two options for proceeding: either skipping ahead or retrying the validation that caused the error.
segment.target: However, you have two options for proceeding: either skipping ahead or retrying the validation that caused the error.

segment.source: Before deciding which option is best, please read the following What happens? section.
segment.target: Before deciding which option is best, please read the following What happens? section.

segment.source: You may be able to fix the problem elsewhere before you click on one of the options.
segment.target: You may be able to fix the problem elsewhere before you click on one of the options.

segment.source: Click here to continue using unsupported policies: click on this to continue first run.
segment.target: Click here to continue using unsupported policies: click on this to continue first run.

segment.source: The Surface Hub will not be able to use Exchange services, or sync.
segment.target: The Surface Hub will not be able to use Exchange services, or sync.

segment.source: Retry: check the policy on the Exchange server again.
segment.target: Retry: check the policy on the Exchange server again.

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: The Surface Hub checks whether the device account’s EAS policy has the PasswordEnabled policy set to 0 (False).
segment.target: The Surface Hub checks whether the device account’s EAS policy has the PasswordEnabled policy set to 0 (False).

segment.source: If this is not the case, mail and calendar can't be synced and the Surface Hub can't use any Exchange services.
segment.target: If this is not the case, mail and calendar can't be synced and the Surface Hub can't use any Exchange services.

segment.source: You can use your Exchange management tools from a PC to check that the device account has the PasswordEnabled policy set to 0.
segment.target: You can use your Exchange management tools from a PC to check that the device account has the PasswordEnabled policy set to 0.

segment.source: If that's not the case, you can reconfigure the account and click Retry here.
segment.target: If that's not the case, you can reconfigure the account and click Retry here.

segment.source: If the policy has already been configured properly, check that your device is properly connected to the network or Internet, and can reach your Exchange server, because this page will also be shown if the Surface Hub can't reach the Exchange server.
segment.target: If the policy has already been configured properly, check that your device is properly connected to the network or Internet, and can reach your Exchange server, because this page will also be shown if the Surface Hub can't reach the Exchange server.

segment.source: Another possible reason for not being able to reach Exchange is because of certificate-based authentication.
segment.target: Another possible reason for not being able to reach Exchange is because of certificate-based authentication.

segment.source: You may wind up on this page because of certificate issues.
segment.target: You may wind up on this page because of certificate issues.

segment.source: Note that if the device displays error codes 0x80072F0D or 0X800C0019, then a certificate is required.
segment.target: Note that if the device displays error codes 0x80072F0D or 0X800C0019, then a certificate is required.

segment.source: Because provisioning is done on the first page of the first run process, you must disable Exchange services by clicking Click here to continue using unsupported policies, and then install the correct certificates through the Settings app.
segment.target: Because provisioning is done on the first page of the first run process, you must disable Exchange services by clicking Click here to continue using unsupported policies, and then install the correct certificates through the Settings app.

segment.source: If you choose to skip this check, the Surface Hub will stop looking for the Exchange server and validating EAS policies, and no Exchange services will be enabled.
segment.target: If you choose to skip this check, the Surface Hub will stop looking for the Exchange server and validating EAS policies, and no Exchange services will be enabled.

segment.source: See Intro to Surface Hub for details on setup dependencies.
segment.target: See Intro to Surface Hub for details on setup dependencies.

segment.source: Name this device page
segment.target: Name this device page

segment.source: This page asks you to provide two names that will be used for identifying the Surface Hub.
segment.target: This page asks you to provide two names that will be used for identifying the Surface Hub.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: If the default values shown are correct, then you can click Next to go on.
segment.target: If the default values shown are correct, then you can click Next to go on.

segment.source: Otherwise, enter data in one or both of the text boxes.
segment.target: Otherwise, enter data in one or both of the text boxes.

segment.source: Friendly name: This is the name that people will see when they want to wirelessly connect to the Surface Hub.
segment.target: Friendly name: This is the name that people will see when they want to wirelessly connect to the Surface Hub.

segment.source: Device name: Can be set to any unique name as described on the screen.
segment.target: Device name: Can be set to any unique name as described on the screen.

segment.source: As long as both names are within the length requirements and do not use restricted characters, clicking Next will take you to the next page, Set up admins for this device.
segment.target: As long as both names are within the length requirements and do not use restricted characters, clicking Next will take you to the next page, Set up admins for this device.

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: The Surface Hub requires two names for the device, which will default to:
segment.target: The Surface Hub requires two names for the device, which will default to:

segment.source: Friendly name: Defaults to the Display Name of the device account
segment.target: Friendly name: Defaults to the Display Name of the device account

segment.source: Device name: Defaults to the alias of the device account
segment.target: Device name: Defaults to the alias of the device account

segment.source: While either of the names can be changed later, keep in mind that:
segment.target: While either of the names can be changed later, keep in mind that:

segment.source: The friendly name should be recognizable and different so that people can distinguish one Surface Hub from another when trying to wirelessly connect.
segment.target: The friendly name should be recognizable and different so that people can distinguish one Surface Hub from another when trying to wirelessly connect.

segment.source: If you decide to domain join the device, the device name must not be the same as any other device on the account’s Active Directory domain.
segment.target: If you decide to domain join the device, the device name must not be the same as any other device on the account’s Active Directory domain.

segment.source: The device can't join the domain if it is using the same name as another domain-joined device.
segment.target: The device can't join the domain if it is using the same name as another domain-joined device.

segment.source: Set up admins for this device page
segment.target: Set up admins for this device page

segment.source: On this page, you will choose from several options for how you want to set up admin accounts to locally manage your device.
segment.target: On this page, you will choose from several options for how you want to set up admin accounts to locally manage your device.

segment.source: Because every Surface Hub can be used by any number of authenticated employees, settings are locked down so that they can't change from session to session.
segment.target: Because every Surface Hub can be used by any number of authenticated employees, settings are locked down so that they can't change from session to session.

segment.source: Only admins can configure the settings on the device, and on this page, you’ll choose which type of admins have that privilege.
segment.target: Only admins can configure the settings on the device, and on this page, you’ll choose which type of admins have that privilege.

segment.source: Note The purpose of this page is primarily to determine who can configure the device from the device’s UI; that is, who can actually visit a device, log in, open up the Settings app, and make changes to the Settings.
segment.target: Note The purpose of this page is primarily to determine who can configure the device from the device’s UI; that is, who can actually visit a device, log in, open up the Settings app, and make changes to the Settings.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Choose one of the three available options:
segment.target: Choose one of the three available options:

segment.source: Use Microsoft Azure Active Directory
segment.target: Use Microsoft Azure Active Directory

segment.source: Use Active Directory Domain Services
segment.target: Use Active Directory Domain Services

segment.source: Use a local admin
segment.target: Use a local admin

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: This is what happens when you choose an option.
segment.target: This is what happens when you choose an option.

segment.source: Use Microsoft Azure Active Directory
segment.target: Use Microsoft Azure Active Directory

segment.source: Clicking this option allows you to join the device to Azure AD.
segment.target: Clicking this option allows you to join the device to Azure AD.

segment.source: Once you click Next, the device will restart to apply some settings, and then you’ll be taken to the Use Microsoft Azure Active Directory page and asked to enter credentials that can allow you to join Azure AD.
segment.target: Once you click Next, the device will restart to apply some settings, and then you’ll be taken to the Use Microsoft Azure Active Directory page and asked to enter credentials that can allow you to join Azure AD.

segment.source: After joining, admins from the joined organization will be able to use the Settings app.
segment.target: After joining, admins from the joined organization will be able to use the Settings app.

segment.source: The specific people that will be allowed depends on your Azure AD subscription and how you’ve configured the settings for your Azure AD organization.
segment.target: The specific people that will be allowed depends on your Azure AD subscription and how you’ve configured the settings for your Azure AD organization.

segment.source: Use Active Directory Domain Services
segment.target: Use Active Directory Domain Services

segment.source: Click this option to join the device to AD.
segment.target: Click this option to join the device to AD.

segment.source: Once you click Next, you’ll be taken to the Use Active Directory Domain Services page and asked to enter credentials that allow you to join the specified domain.
segment.target: Once you click Next, you’ll be taken to the Use Active Directory Domain Services page and asked to enter credentials that allow you to join the specified domain.

segment.source: After joining, you can pick a security group from the joined domain, and people from that security group will be able to use the Settings app.
segment.target: After joining, you can pick a security group from the joined domain, and people from that security group will be able to use the Settings app.

segment.source: Use a local admin
segment.target: Use a local admin

segment.source: Choosing this option will allow you to create a single local admin.
segment.target: Choosing this option will allow you to create a single local admin.

segment.source: This admin won’t be backed by any directory service, so we recommend you only choose this case if the device does not have access to Azure AD or AD.
segment.target: This admin won’t be backed by any directory service, so we recommend you only choose this case if the device does not have access to Azure AD or AD.

segment.source: Once you create an admin’s user name and password on the Use a local admin page, you will need to re-enter those same credentials whenever you open the Settings app.
segment.target: Once you create an admin’s user name and password on the Use a local admin page, you will need to re-enter those same credentials whenever you open the Settings app.

segment.source: Note that a local admin must have physical access to the Surface Hub to log in.
segment.target: Note that a local admin must have physical access to the Surface Hub to log in.

segment.source: Note After you finish this process, you won't be able to change the device's admin option unless you reset the device.
segment.target: Note After you finish this process, you won't be able to change the device's admin option unless you reset the device.

segment.source: Use Microsoft Azure Active Directory
segment.target: Use Microsoft Azure Active Directory

segment.source: If you've decided to join your Surface Hub to Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), you'll see this What happens next page.
segment.target: If you've decided to join your Surface Hub to Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), you'll see this What happens next page.

segment.source: Read it and click Next to go to the Let's get you signed in page.
segment.target: Read it and click Next to go to the Let's get you signed in page.

segment.source: Joining Azure AD has two primary benefits:
segment.target: Joining Azure AD has two primary benefits:

segment.source: Some employees from your organization will be able to access the device as admins, and will be able to start the Settings app and configure the device.
segment.target: Some employees from your organization will be able to access the device as admins, and will be able to start the Settings app and configure the device.

segment.source: People that have admin permissions will be defined in your Azure AD subscription.
segment.target: People that have admin permissions will be defined in your Azure AD subscription.

segment.source: If your Azure AD is connected to a mobile device management (MDM) solution, the device will enroll with that MDM solution so you can apply policies and configuration.
segment.target: If your Azure AD is connected to a mobile device management (MDM) solution, the device will enroll with that MDM solution so you can apply policies and configuration.

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: The following input is required:
segment.target: The following input is required:

segment.source: User's UPN: The user principal name (UPN) of an account that can join Azure AD.
segment.target: User's UPN: The user principal name (UPN) of an account that can join Azure AD.

segment.source: Password: The password of the account you’re using to join Azure AD.
segment.target: Password: The password of the account you’re using to join Azure AD.

segment.source: If you get to this point and don't have valid credentials for an Azure AD account, the device will allow you to continue by creating a local admin account.
segment.target: If you get to this point and don't have valid credentials for an Azure AD account, the device will allow you to continue by creating a local admin account.

segment.source: Click Set up Windows with a local account instead.
segment.target: Click Set up Windows with a local account instead.

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: Once you enter valid Azure AD account credentials, the device will try to join the associated Azure AD organization.
segment.target: Once you enter valid Azure AD account credentials, the device will try to join the associated Azure AD organization.

segment.source: If this succeeds, then the device will provision employees in that organization to be local admins on the device.
segment.target: If this succeeds, then the device will provision employees in that organization to be local admins on the device.

segment.source: If your Azure AD tenant was configured for it, the device will also enroll into MDM.
segment.target: If your Azure AD tenant was configured for it, the device will also enroll into MDM.

segment.source: Use Active Directory Domain Services
segment.target: Use Active Directory Domain Services

segment.source: This page will ask for credentials to join a domain so that the Surface Hub can provision a security group as administrators of the device.
segment.target: This page will ask for credentials to join a domain so that the Surface Hub can provision a security group as administrators of the device.

segment.source: Once the device has been domain joined, you must specify a security group from the domain you joined.
segment.target: Once the device has been domain joined, you must specify a security group from the domain you joined.

segment.source: This security group will be provisioned as administrators on the Surface Hub, and anyone from the security group can enter their domain credentials to access Settings.
segment.target: This security group will be provisioned as administrators on the Surface Hub, and anyone from the security group can enter their domain credentials to access Settings.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: The following input is required:
segment.target: The following input is required:

segment.source: Domain: This is the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the domain that you want to join.
segment.target: Domain: This is the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the domain that you want to join.

segment.source: A security group from this domain can be used to manage the device.
segment.target: A security group from this domain can be used to manage the device.

segment.source: User name: The user name of an account that has sufficient permission to join the specified domain.
segment.target: User name: The user name of an account that has sufficient permission to join the specified domain.

segment.source: Password: The password for the account.
segment.target: Password: The password for the account.

segment.source: After the credentials are verified, you will be asked to type a security group name.
segment.target: After the credentials are verified, you will be asked to type a security group name.

segment.source: This input is required.
segment.target: This input is required.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: Using the provided domain, account credentials from the Use Active Directory Domain Services page and the device name from the Name this device page, the Surface Hub will attempt to join the domain.
segment.target: Using the provided domain, account credentials from the Use Active Directory Domain Services page and the device name from the Name this device page, the Surface Hub will attempt to join the domain.

segment.source: If the join is successful, first run will continue, and will ask for a security group.
segment.target: If the join is successful, first run will continue, and will ask for a security group.

segment.source: If the join is not successful, first run will halt and ask you to change the information provided.
segment.target: If the join is not successful, first run will halt and ask you to change the information provided.

segment.source: If the join is successful, you'll see the Enter a security group page.
segment.target: If the join is successful, you'll see the Enter a security group page.

segment.source: When you click the Select button on this page, the device will search for the specified security group on your domain.
segment.target: When you click the Select button on this page, the device will search for the specified security group on your domain.

segment.source: If found, the group will be verified.
segment.target: If found, the group will be verified.

segment.source: Click Finish to complete the first run process.
segment.target: Click Finish to complete the first run process.

segment.source: Note If you domain join the Surface Hub, you can't unjoin the device without resetting it.
segment.target: Note If you domain join the Surface Hub, you can't unjoin the device without resetting it.

segment.source: Use a local admin
segment.target: Use a local admin

segment.source: If you decide not to use Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) or Active Directory (AD) to manage the Surface Hub, you'll need to create a local admin account.
segment.target: If you decide not to use Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) or Active Directory (AD) to manage the Surface Hub, you'll need to create a local admin account.

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: The following input is required:
segment.target: The following input is required:

segment.source: User name: This is the user name of the local admin account that will be created for this Surface Hub.
segment.target: User name: This is the user name of the local admin account that will be created for this Surface Hub.

segment.source: Password: This is the password of the device account.
segment.target: Password: This is the password of the device account.

segment.source: Re-enter password: Verifying the password as in the previous box.
segment.target: Re-enter password: Verifying the password as in the previous box.

segment.source: What happens?
segment.target: What happens?

segment.source: This page will attempt to create a new admin account using the credentials that you enter here.
segment.target: This page will attempt to create a new admin account using the credentials that you enter here.

segment.source: If it's successful, then first run will end.
segment.target: If it's successful, then first run will end.

segment.source: If not, you'll be asked for different credentials.
segment.target: If not, you'll be asked for different credentials.

segment.source: Update the Surface Hub
segment.target: Update the Surface Hub

segment.source: Important Before you do the updates, make sure you read Save your BitLocker key in order to make sure you have a backup of the key.
segment.target: Important Before you do the updates, make sure you read Save your BitLocker key in order to make sure you have a backup of the key.

segment.source: In order to get the latest features and fixes, you should update your Surface Hub as soon as you finish all of the preceding first-run steps.
segment.target: In order to get the latest features and fixes, you should update your Surface Hub as soon as you finish all of the preceding first-run steps.

segment.source: Make sure the device has access to the Windows Update servers or to Windows Server Update Services (WSUS).
segment.target: Make sure the device has access to the Windows Update servers or to Windows Server Update Services (WSUS).

segment.source: To configure WSUS, see Using WSUS.
segment.target: To configure WSUS, see Using WSUS.

segment.source: Open Settings, click Update & security, then Windows Update, and then click Check for updates.
segment.target: Open Settings, click Update & security, then Windows Update, and then click Check for updates.

segment.source: If updates are available, they will be downloaded.
segment.target: If updates are available, they will be downloaded.

segment.source: Once downloading is complete, click the Update now button to install the updates.
segment.target: Once downloading is complete, click the Update now button to install the updates.

segment.source: Follow the onscreen prompts after the updates are installed.
segment.target: Follow the onscreen prompts after the updates are installed.

segment.source: You may need to restart the device.
segment.target: You may need to restart the device.
